description: From Latin intermittere, from inter- + mittere.

verbs.description: intermit (third-person singular simple present intermits, present participle intermitting, simple past and past participle intermitted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare) To interrupt, to stop or cease temporarily or periodically; to suspend.
examples: The bell doth toll for him, that thinks it doth; and though it intermit again, yet from that minute, that that occasion wrought upon him, he is united to God.
